data.title: Nice Stay
data.text: Recently stayed for a few nights - room 221. Check in / check out was fast. Room was clean and comfortable. Like the layout with doors to separate living / sleeping area. Located in quiet area, close to mall, places to eat & shop. Needs a little TLC - tub surrounding was cracked & found it strange that maid service used photocopied notes ( poor quality) to say thank you & left water, candy, & other drinks with the note. Nice touch (thoughtful) but would suggest higher quality notes. Over all - nice stay!

data.title: Awesome rooms, good location
data.text: Well, the #1 reason this place was amazing besides the room size (2 adults, 2 small kids fit great), was Sierra, the front desk employee.  She really got to know everyone who came in and quickly accommodated.  She knew about the rooms and I overheard her booking someone on the phone who clearly didn't know that this place isn't a "make a quick buck on the lowest deal" kind of place.  They don't overbook or over-promise.  The rooms are super nice for what you pay (the showers were basic but functioning).  We got a king room.  It had a completely separate door to the rest of the room making it great for the kids to get sleep while we could relax.  We bought through Hotwire but I wouldn't have minded spending more.  Would definitely book again.  Oh, and they were doing construction on the hotel on the roof but even on the top floor we heard nothing from inside our room!

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear to Sierra made a great impression on you while you were here with us. She is a great team member and we are lucky to have her here. I will pass along your compliments and we look forward to having you back here anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A very memorable weekend in Denver
data.text: Me and my wife were in town for the Broncos game and family visits, I have to say we enjoyed our stay very much at this Comfort Suites in the Denver Tech Center we usually stay downtown or North Aurora but for the game we chose the convenience for this trip. we are glad we did. Tori the front desk agent was very polite prompt and courteous, we had a bit of Luggage and a lady I believe her name was Jessica ?? asked us if we needed assistance. What a Delight!! Jessica was very informative about the weekends activities and we actually enjoyed one of her mentioned attractions, the gardens I think? Any how we had a wonderful stay at this particular Comfort Suites, The staff is amazing, the hotel very clean and maybe nexttime we will partake in the swimming pool and hot tub. Thank you Comfort DTC you made our visit a great one! The P famil

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your recent stay with us. I will definitely pass along your wonderful comments to the staff and we hope to have you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Chargers game day!
data.text: What is there to say this hotel is absolutely great. the staff is amamazing, I've never had the pleasure of having my luggage taken to my vehicle before now thank you Jessica you were great. the breakfast buffet was hot and plentiful. My towels were new and my room was spotless, thank you Rosa.I hope to be back with my wife next visit and make use of one of the Luxury suites!

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review and compliments. I am glad to hear that you enjoyed the great service we always aim to provide to our guests. We look forward to having you back with us soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing employees.
data.text:
We were in the area we needed to be.  Beds were fantastic.  Room clean.  Convenient breakfast.  All employees so friendly and helpful.
The hospitality hour in the evening was nice but could be improved.  Pool area is being renovated.  Hot tub needs repair  or replacement.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your recent stay with us. I will get together with the other managers and see how we can improve upon the evening reception we offer and the hot tub. Please come back anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Stay
data.text: The stay was great. Had a small issue with the bed sheets, and me and my daughter breaking out. The situation was handled in a timely manner. The manager Jose (I think was his name) went out of his way to accommodate us. The hotel was nice, comfortable, and friendly. We will be back in April.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad that we were able to take care of you and your daughter the best way we could. We look forward to having you back with us next year.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent location and staff
data.text: We stay in Denver often, and this is a first choice for us.  The rooms are large, comfortable, reasonably priced.  The desk staff is consistently helpful.  The breakfast is very good, and it includes hard boiled eggs.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for your review and compliments. It is great to hear our hotel is your choice to stay at when in town. I will share your comments with the rest of the team here and we look forward to having you back with us soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel
data.text: Nice and clean, great amenities.  Large room with sitting area with couch and chair. TV in each room. Lots of outlets for recharging electronics. Fridge, microwave, extra sink. Free breakfast is nice: eggs, bacon, toast, bagels, cereal, etc.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review and compliments. We look forward to having you back with us soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: It's a weak 4
data.text: This is an early comfort Suites design. Still it is a nice place to stay. We had a two room suite and it was just $103 booked directly with Choice Hotels web site. The furnishings were a bit dated but we did not see any of the worn out everything another reviewer mentioned. The property is well maintained, clean and comfortable. We did not use the pool or the fitness center but I did look at them and they appeared to be clean. The breakfast was fine. The usual Comfort Suites fare. Some biscuits and gravy would have been a nice touch but it was a good breakfast. Kudos to the girl that worked Saturday evening. Victoria I believe. She found a fan for us so my wife could have her "white noise" to sleep with since the AC unit does not have a continuous on setting. She took it to our room while we went out to dinner. Sweet girl.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that overall, you enjoyed your recent stay with us. We look forward to having you back anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: First time in Denver and the hotel was pretty nice
data.text: I thought the location of the hotel was great. Easy access to the main highway 25 and many stores and restaurants nearby as well as the light rail only a short walk from the hotel. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff at the desk were very helpful. Really good breakfast included. The social hour was a nice added feature. My only complaint was some noise on nights three through seven where it sounded like someone was stomping overhead, I would suggest a top floor room to avoid this. The only issue I had was that the fitness room was very dated and the equipment a bit rickety. I was disappointed because I do enjoy a good cardio workout most days.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that overall you enjoyed your stay with us. I will look into the fitness center issues you experienced and see what we can do to make it better. We look forward to having you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I don't understand the good reviews
data.text: My coworker and I stayed two nights at the Comfort Suites DTC hotel in October.  I am a Choice Hotel platinum member so I stay at a lot of Comfort Suite hotels.  This one was, at best, average.  The staff were not very friendly at either check-in or when we needed to have them rekey our cards because they quite working.  The bathroom door jam was completely rusted out - I should have taken a picture.  It really was quite disgusting.  And the bathroom smelled like a sewer.  On the plus side, the room was quite large.  Breakfast was the usual and they did offer a pasta dish at night but I didn't eat it so can't review how good it was.  We are planning on working in the area quite a bit and will choose another hotel next time.  Not only are there a lot of choices in the area, but they are overpriced for a Choice hotel.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review in regards to your recent stay with us. On behalf of the hotel, I would like to apologize for not exceeding your expectations. Our goal is to provide a clean and comfortable room and give great service to all of our guests every time. We will definitely use your feedback to improve upon the quality of both the hotel and service we deliver here. As a Choice Privilege Elite member, your loyalty and response are always welcomed and appreciated and I do hope that you will give us another opportunity in the future to earn your business.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Property is dirty on the outside, rooms were good, dated but good.
data.text:
Manager gets in your face when you question policies. New to hotel business and was rude. Property is dirty on the outside, rooms were good, dated but good. 

Could hear tv next to me and people talking walls are thin. Manager has no tact thinks he running a tight ship but lacks hospitality skills. Very upsetting should you have an issue. 
Manager gets in your face when you question policies. New to hotel business and was rude. Property is dirty on the outside, rooms were good, dated but good. 

Manager credited room removed my items even after asking him to not do so. I made a reservation on a different night and they were sold out. 

I need some time to get to the hotel. He removed all items without my permission, I even offered to pay a late checkout fee $30-50 so I could come by and pack. He didn't even try to compromise???

I may be missing items. He seems to take great "enjoyment and bravado" to show he can do whatever he like versus helping a guest. He was VERY aggressive to me I had to take a step back as he talked with me. He thinks intimidating guests is how you manage. He sends an email after to cover up his behavior with me on the phone. I met him after he sent the email (I had not read it yet), he was rude did not apologize and seemed like "get out of here" and forgot that I am a Choice Member...for that I will not return I would like to speak to the owner and discuss. I'm not sure he knows how to treat guests. 

I remained calm but am shocked he clean out my items before they even cleaned the room at 3 pm I arrived???

My client pays the room, they got a free night. Its like here is a free night and get out.

I will never stay AGAIN at Comfort Inn and Suites Denver Tech center in Englewood, CO

UPDATE- 
You did not apologize, in fact you wrote emails but when we met were aggressive and rude after sending me a email. Your actions after the email were clear about how you treat guests.  I hate to get in the way of a good story with facts you cost me 1000.00 in revenue, would not take 30-50 dollars in a late checkout fees so I could simple pack up my stuff , your arrogant, " I am the GM" attitude was not appreciated 

You had not cleaned the rooms before I arrived and the housekeeping team had not touched the room.  In fact you lied indicating you "received approval and authority from Choice Hotels to empty a room w/o permission  ( FYI They are a franchiser, you make the business decisions.)

Its sad people like you are in the hospitality business.  Had you acted as in your reply,  we would not be having a discussion. Years in position does not mean maturity. Congruence and a mature balanced hospitable attitude leaves guest pleased not pushed around.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
This review is a duplicate from a past guest who gave us his feedback back in June. I responded at that time to his review with the following:

 I apologized to you for the inconvenience you experienced while with us and refunded your stay as a courtesy to you. I am not new to Hospitality, as I have been in the industry for over a decade and although I am not perfect, I do try to take care of our guests, employees and hotel as best as I possibly can. Also, I never got in your face, as when we spoke, we were several feet away from each other. Even after apologizing to you for standing behind the decision I made, you were insulting, sarcastic and condescending. I am sorry you feel you didn't receive great service while with us. 

Although I appreciate any and all honest feedback, it is very sad that you felt it necessary for what ever reason to repost the same review over 2 months later.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great central location
data.text: Rooms were Clean, nice indoor pool, hot tub. Nice suite with a separate bedroom. Fold out bed in living area, worked for our adult daughter, but not real comfortable. Good breakfast with hot selections.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad that overall you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to having you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Exceptional value close to great restaurants
data.text: Rooms are spacious, staff is friendly, and breakfast is great. With only 72 rooms, they treat everyone like a VIP. You can walk to restaurants. I definitely will stay there again. Because they are close to many office buildings, they are usually booked. Reserve well in advance. Highly recommend this first class hotel that you can enjoy at less than premium prices.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review and wonderful compliments. It is always a pleasure to hear that one of our guests enjoyed their stay and the service that we aim to provide. We hope you will choose our hotel anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not bad for a suite type hotel!
data.text: This Comfort Suites is located in the area know as "Centennial" close to highway 25 that takes you to downtown. The hotel is small but provides enough things frequent traveler needs such as nice decent size bedroom, comfortable bed, TV, A/C and a decent size bedroom. Moreover, every morning you can view the mountains from the window. The hotel offers a regular breakfast: eggs, sausages, cereal, milk, oat milk, yogurt, pancakes, coffee and fruit. The place is clean and you could find great restaurants not far. For instance, Maggiano's Little Italy is across the hotel, and Purple Ginger, Asian Fusion is located next door. Centennial Promenade, One of Denver's largest outdoor shopping complex is just 1.5 miles away. Hotel offers free WiFi and has an indoor pool and a business center.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed our hotel location and stay with us. We look forward to having you back anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Central Location
data.text: We travelled in every direction in Colorado from this hotel.  Great value.  The breakfast was good and they even turned on the lights for us on our last morning so we could eat before catching a very early flight.  The pool is inside and looks nice but the room it is in seems to be under going some renovation.   Nice kitchenette area with a sofa.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please come back  soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Not as expected
data.text: The girls running the front desk are sweet except one late at night that avoided answering any questions about the area or even to make eye contact. Breakfast is a great benefit in the mornings bit gotta get up early to catch a bite. Not a problem for me and the wife on this trip. Two things I want the management to know about so they can improve on their customers experience. 1: your beds are hard as stone and if your sheets slip you see the age and the stains on the bed wich almost disgusted my wife into just sleeping on the couch. I know these kinds of beds keep your costs down when you have to replace them but I expected more from comfort suites which I have heard many good things about. 2 : im sorry cleanliness of a hotel is a pet peeve of mine and yea the hotel is clean for the most part but if you look closer hidden things like the mattresses or the random pile of trash in the corner of the elevator that was there for two days or the graffiti scratched into the metal inside the elevator itself makes the place look a bit trashy. Also today as we came back from garden of the gods there was a few bags if trash just sitting out side the elevator. Now, I just took this as someone was cleaning out some cans and was going to take it out no problem not a second thought... Two hours later I came down and its still there.. ok I said something under my breath to my wife because that got on my nerves a little I'm sorry.. we went to get pizza at MOD and drove around Denver for probably another two hours. We come back in and wow... It's still there... I got a little louder and was hoping the front desk attendant heard me about it and went upstairs on my merry way... We watched a three hour movie on HBO which was cool that they had that and went back down to get snacks from the snack bar which is also nice.... Aaaand there it is.. still... This time it's leaking and I literally said as I was coming out of the elevator " does someone need me to help them take out the freaking trash?" I said it kinda loud and I think I startled the girl behind the desk but I did not see an effort to apologize for the mess or to try and get someone to take it out to the dumpster. I just want management to know about these things because I know you read them and try a little harder to make your guests feel comfortable.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback in regards to your recent stay with us. On behalf of the hotel, I would like to apologize for the issues you experienced. It is our goal to provide a clean hotel and great service to all of our guests. I will definitely be speaking with our team about your issues so we can improve upon the quality of the service and product we provide. I do hope that you will come back and give us another opportunity to earn your business.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good for transport links
data.text: We stayed here for 4 nights in August. Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean and had a separate living area. Breakfast was ok - it was often very busy but there was a good selection of food. The pool was good and the hot tub was great to use in an evening. The hotel is also very close to I25 and it is easy to get into Denver. I can recommend this hotel.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your compliments and recommendation. We hope to have you back anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good location while in Denver
data.text: My wife and I were in Denver for a Bronco game and chose this property for its location and value. It  was close to shopping, restaurants, and RTD light transit to downtown Denver and football stadium.  We were pleasantly surprised that it was spacious, comfortable beds, decent breakfast and was easily accessed by light rail, yet far enough away from major interstate I-25, so it was noisy. Well worth the $70.00/night rate.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to having you back soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Outpatient surgery stay
data.text: I had to have surgery nearby and this hotel offered a medical discount to patients of this particular surgical center. They were so wonderful. Room was very large and comfortable. We had everything we needed. It was a little loud trying to sleep during the day, but it was just usual stuff like vacuum cleaners and mowers. Continental breakfast is outstanding. I would definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: comfortsuitesdtc, General Manager at Comfort Suites Denver Tech Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you very much for your compliments and feedback in regards to your recent stay with us. I am glad that you enjoyed your room here. Please come back anytime you are in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
